readability_reflection: String concatenation. It was easier to just append each string using the parentheses instead of determining where each interpolation started and ended
comprehension_debugging: The shorter ones, yes. But the longer ones with multiple math equations took the same amount of time
preference_rationale: I would choose concatenation as I am more familiar with that approach. If I practice interpolation more, I could see it becoming more popular for me in the future
learning_curve: I am familiar with string concatenation, so that was easier to translate
suggestions_improvement: Color coding parentheses/curly brackets, or some other kind of flag to determine where each snippet is encapsulating.
